definition[0]: to become firm or stiff, or to make something firm or stiff
example[0]: It will take about 24 hours for the glue to harden.
definition[1]: if your attitude hardens, or if something hardens it, you become more strict and determined and less sympathetic
example[1]: Attitudes towards the terrorists have hardened even more since the attack.
definition[2]: if your face or voice hardens, or if something hardens it, you look or sound less sympathetic or happy
example[2]: His face hardened momentarily, then he looked away.
definition[3]: if prices on a financial market harden, they go up
